title: HiLiTe
summary: A machine learning pipeline that turns full-length soccer matches into highlight reels with AI-generated commentary in minutes.
specifics: Soccer has been part of my life forever, and I've always wanted to understand the game through data
Whenever I missed a soccer game, I would have to wait hours for the highlights to be uploaded to YouTube. So I built this.
Built a vision pipeline for frame and clip extraction, event detection, and moment scoring
Used PyTorch and OpenCV for video processing and feature extraction
Generated sports-style commentary for key moments using vision-language methods
Synchronized narration with selected clips to create coherent highlight reels
Built an interactive Streamlit demo for testing and showcasing the system
Combined computer vision, NLP, and deep learning into one end-to-end pipeline
architecture: Video ingestion → moment scoring → vision features → (VLM-based) narration → timeline assembly/export

title: Portfolio & Iris
summary: This site. Built to show who I am, with Iris as a conversational way to learn exactly what you want to know. Custom RAG pipeline under the hood.
specifics: Named Iris after the Greek messenger goddess, part of a longer-term vision for personal AI assistants to help me work faster and smarter (Iris for digital, Hermes eventually for a physical robot)
Built a custom RAG pipeline with embeddings retrieval, semantic search, intent detection, and streaming LLM responses (like what ChatGPT does but for my own data)
Designed intelligent quick actions that suggest related items based on complexity, impact, and recency scores
Config-driven action system that tracks what you've already visited and adapts suggestions based on conversation depth
Command palette (⌘K) for instant search and Iris chat integration
Structured knowledge base with filters, year-based queries, and personal context retrieval
Production deployment with Redis caching, rate limiting, and Supabase for message storage
Cross type navigation connecting projects, skills, experiences, and classes with smart suggestions
architecture: Next.js 15 (App Router) → RAG backend (embeddings + cosine + intent detection) → GPT streaming → Iris UI (palette + chat)

title: Euro Predictor
summary: Predicted Euro 2024 outcomes by scraping data and training ML models. Reached top 3% in UEFA's prediction game.
specifics: My friends and I were competing with one another about the UEFA European Football Championship in 2024, so I built this to help me out.
Built web scrapers to collect fixtures, team stats, and historical form data
Engineered features using Pandas and NumPy to capture what actually predicted match outcomes
Trained Random Forest classifiers with cross-validation and hyperparameter tuning
Produced expected goals style predictions and discrete scoreline forecasts
Ran error analysis and calibration to understand where the model was breaking down
Top 3% finish validated the approach against thousands of other predictors (and won my fantasy league)
architecture: Scraper → feature store (CSV/Parquet) → model training (RF) → inference/evaluation notebooks

title: Momentum
summary: A voice-first iOS app for productivity. Real-time transcription, GPT intent parsing, and adaptive text-to-speech feedback.
specifics: Built a streaming speech recognition pipeline with under one second perceived latency
Used GPT to parse intent from transcribed speech and trigger actions like reminders, calendar events, and to-dos
Implemented low latency text to speech with interruption handling so the app feels responsive
Designed the UX around privacy and minimal friction
Built entirely in SwiftUI with AVFoundation for audio capture
Ran TestFlight feedback cycles and iterated based on what users actually needed
architecture: Audio capture → ASR → intent (LLM) → action execution → TTS playback; reactive state with SwiftUI

title: BB&N's Knight Life
summary: An iOS app I built in high school that became the way everyone checked schedules, read news, and got notified of school updates. 4.9 stars on the App Store.
specifics: Built because the school's schedule was confusing and nobody had a good way to check it
Made the first version in just 3 days, App Store in a week
Centralized schedules with reliable local caching so it worked offline
Added notifications so students knew when things changed
Released updates continuously based on feedback from classmates
Handled end-to-end App Store deployment and support
Became widely adopted across the school and maintained a 4.9 star rating
Created and taught a Knight Life team (Calavrian LLC) to work in Swift and take over from me after I left; app is still used and updated with over 80% of the school as daily active users
architecture: Native iOS app with Firebase backend for sync/messaging; notification scheduling and offline-first caching
